Tap Refresh to get your current location. Save current spot to log with a name. View or delete logs in the Log tab.
This app needs location access to show coordinates, altitude and time.
Location unavailable. Check permission and try again.

Altitude from coordinates: Obtained from Open-Elevation API (https://api.open-elevation.com), which uses global DEM (Digital Elevation Model, e.g. SRTM) data. Given latitude and longitude, the API returns the ground surface elevation in metres at that point. No formula—direct lookup from the elevation dataset. Requires network.

Altitude from device: Provided by the device barometer (pressure sensor) or GPS/altitude fusion. When available, Android Location gives altitude in metres. It is often derived from the barometric formula: h = 44330 × (1 − (p/p₀)^0.19), where p is measured pressure and p₀ is sea-level reference pressure. Devices without a barometer show N/A.
